Hi, I'm Chris Busse

I am a recent graduate of the University of Florida where I earned a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science Engineering. I am experienced with both front end and back end web development, and am looking to enter industry as a Junior Web Developer. Hopefully this website will give some insight into where my skills lie as well as letting you know a bit about me. Thanks for stopping by!

Technical Skills

Experienced using the latest web standards of HTML, CSS, and Javascript to create responsive and easy to use web designs.

Familiar with the use of other Web Development tools and frameworks, including AngularJS, jQuery, and SQL.

Additional Skills

Self Taught

Nearly all of my skills in programming have been Self Taught. I'm skilled in picking up new programming languages quickly, and learning how to operate in new and exciting environments.

User Experience Design

Designing products with the user's experience in mind leads to improving accessibility and usability of products. During my schooling I studied many aspects of UXD for use in a wide variety of products.

Client Relations

For multiple projects I've worked closesly with clients in order to develop a product that fits their needs. I've gained experience bridging the gap between a real world problem, and a designed solution.

Development Lifecycle

From planning out basic designs to maintaining systems and analyzing their shortcomings, I am experienced in working in every stage of the Software Development Lifecycle

Projects

DayCamp Web Application

The DayCamp Web App is a current project that I am very excited to work on. Approached by a day care business owner in Michigan, myself and two other seniors at UF have begun working on a project that will greatly simplify the lives of not only the employees, but also the parents that do business there. We've worked closely with the client to identify these areas of improvement, and we are currently in the process of developing a product that fits their needs.

This project is being built using the MEANjs Full-Stack, and has been a terrific learning experience for all involved. It is unfortunately not ready to be displayed to the public yet, but expect to see it online come early December. If you would like to see more about this exciting project, please check out the Project Page.
